intro: Ruschia velutina, commonly known as the velvet Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves covered in a fine, velvety coating. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in spring. Ruschia velutina is well adapted to arid environments, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
